title: Blacklisting
body:
Hey Riot, why have I been blacklisted from interacting with "**human beings**" when I report someone and have physical evidence. Yet, they still tend to be playing on this server?
It may only be a one-time thing but even if it's a "one-time thing", I'd like to know Riots actual reason behind letting these players loose. If you provide them with the power to be toxic, can i be toxic as well without getting banned or is it just favoritism for the toxic ones?

replies.body:
There should be no reason that you'd be unable to get a response from a person when interacting with Support. The only time you wouldn't get a person is if it's "Blitzcrank Bot" responding to the ticket, which should only occur in "clear cut" cases, and even then you can request a response from a person and you *should* receive one at that point. Even then, however, the Support staff wont be able to share any information about what action may be taken against other players.

The specific circumstances of any given case can easily impact how it will be dealt with. Chat offences can often lead to chat restrictions, which may appear as though no action has been taken (unlike bans which show a distinct gap in match history), and other types of offences can result in action not being taken *yet* (while still contributing to potential punishments), depending on the degree of the offences (or, in the case of third party software, being delayed due to the "ban wave" approach).
I "request for a human" but even so, I don't get a response :/ I just get a survey and nothing else.

Spamming the same or similar tickets to support can result in them being automatically closed.

There are a few other things that can cause it, but that's the one I've heard of most often. You should always get an explanation in the last ticket before the start auto-closing if it's intentional.

"Spamming the same or similar tickets"

Oh so what your saying is that if i was to say report people to support like i'm meant to according to you, each time i would have to in game (several in a day) they'd automatically get closed after a point?

No, as in if you ticket support with "unban me" and they say, "no, this is why you won't be unbanned" and after being given all the information you proceed to send in 20+ tickets one after the other that basically say "unban me" then it's just spam so they will be auto closed.

Hence my use of the word "spamming" and my lack of use of "submitting multiple valid reports of a similar nature but of different incidents".

Actually, you’re absolutely right.  It’s favoritism plain and simple. Riot favors the toxic ones, just like you suggested.

They have actually purposefully geared their whole support system specifically to make sure that you ‘Noobster’ suffer in particular too.

They singled out your ticket and blacklisted you for your noble attempts at trying to clean up the game.

-

Well, there it is, the answer you clearly wanted to hear.  Do you believe it?

>Actually, you’re absolutely right. It’s favoritism plain and simple. Riot favors the toxic ones

I mean, this is fact after all. 
And therse more evidence to support that than not.
